abstract: Blast walls, a swimming pool, tennis courts, no-profanity warning signs and a limit on chicken wings (six) on Chicken Wing Night in the dining hall. Welcome to the new $750 million U.S. Embassy in Baghdad, the largest facility of its kind in the world. And now it's being downsized.
lead_paragraph: Blast walls, a swimming pool, no-profanity warning signs, tennis courts and a limit on chicken wings (six per person) on Chicken Wing Night in the dining hall. Welcome to the new $750 million U.S. Embassy in Baghdad, the largest facility of its kind in the world. As Tim Arango reports, the State Department is preparing to dramatically downsize the enormous diplomatic presence it had planned for Iraq. See a slide show of scenes from inside the embassy and its sprawling compound. And read Tim's story »

headline.main: U.S. Plans to Cut Iraq Embassy Staff by Half
